org.tair.sql.expression
Class BooleanParameterExpression

java.lang.Object
  org.tair.sql.expression.Expression
      org.tair.sql.expression.AbstractSingleParameterExpression<java.lang.Boolean>
          org.tair.sql.expression.BooleanParameterExpression
All Implemented Interfaces:
IExpression, ISingleParameterExpression<java.lang.Boolean>
public class BooleanParameterExpression
extends AbstractSingleParameterExpression<java.lang.Boolean>

A single-parameter expression with a Boolean parameter. You need to create the object with a boolean type value that tells the object how to store the value in the database. A boolean value is a SQL BIT VARYING type. Most booleans are stored as 1/0, "y"/"n", or "t"/"f" values, but you can also use "yes"/"no" or "true"/"false". This strategy allows you to deal with real Java Boolean values outside this class but translate the data going into and out of the database in the correct manner for your particular schema design, as SQL does not directly support the BOOLEAN data type yet.

Author:
Robert J. Muller

Constructor Detail

BooleanParameterExpression

public BooleanParameterExpression()
Create a BooleanParameterExpression object. This is the default constructor that does nothing, yielding the "null" keyword. Leaves the default Boolean type as INTEGER.

BooleanParameterExpression

public BooleanParameterExpression(java.lang.String expression,
                                  java.lang.Boolean value,
                                  BooleanParameterExpression.Type type)
Create a BooleanParameterExpression object from an expression containing a parameter ? and a value to bind to that parameter on demand. Set the type of the persistent boolean in the database.

Parameters:
expression - the expression string
value - the value to bind on demand
type - the type of the value in the database

BooleanParameterExpression

public BooleanParameterExpression(java.lang.String expression,
                                  BooleanParameterExpression.Type type)
Create a BooleanParameterExpression object from an expression string containing a parameter ?.

Parameters:
expression - the expression string containing a parameter ?
type - the type of the value in the database

BooleanParameterExpression

public BooleanParameterExpression(java.lang.String expression,
                                  java.lang.String value)
Create a BooleanParameterExpression object from a String representation of the Boolean value. This constructor converts the string into a true Boolean value.

Parameters:
expression - the string expression with a parameter ?
value - the string representation of the value
Method Detail

bind

public int bind(java.sql.PreparedStatement stmt,
                int index)
         throws java.sql.SQLException
Description copied from interface: ISingleParameterExpression
Bind the value to the expression parameter ? within the prepared statement using the correct JDBC binding method for the type; the concrete instantiation of the template implements this method.

Parameters:
stmt - the JDBC prepared statement to which to bind the parameter value
index - the parameter index of the parameter (?) to which to bind the value
Returns:
the parameter index of the next value to bind
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - when there is a problem binding the value to the parameter through JDBC
